jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

FEEC27B077FB4B34BD14E95E470DD002.description:
Analyze how the ideals of Jesus have
influenced society.

BAE10D1FBEC742ADAE15D2A9DA673541.description:
Define cultural exchange and provide
examples of cultural exchange between
two groups.

1390BC4C56384A7487A5A1B6C8D3DC29.description:
Explain the impact of prejudice on the
operation of United States social,
political, and economic institutions
over time.

9B1BF982B4304052892A91CF0583F5B6.description:
Analyze how the ideals of the Founders
have influenced the development of
multicultural society in the United
States.

25C878A7D4164387805F5369A16DA5D9.description:
Explain how diverse groups have
enriched United States culture and
Catholic Church culture.

F8FA2EC445FD4A0D94F28BA619C5E9C0.description:
Understand how social systems form and develop over time. Understand how religious/Church social systems form and develop over time. Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5 (K-6 CS)
Value history as a medium to assist in recognizing and rejecting contemporary cultural values that threaten human dignity and are contrary
to the Gospel message. CSDS5 (7-12 CS)
Value unique qualities and characteristics of different cultures in order to pursue peace and understanding, knowledge and truth. CSDS6
(7& 8)

5820B1D8ED9640CF9249B45E444CB41A.description:
Describe how such groups as social
clubs, schools, churches influence the
preservation and transmission of
culture.

F26A93B6E9A04A2A9E344F4DED1BC967.description:
Explain how the changing concept of
social institutions affects groups in
society (e.g., minorities, women,
children, adolescents).

8AA8228637FA4F7289B45CBC8095EB5C.description:
Explain how changing topics of self
and groups (e.g., minorities, women,
children, adolescents) have affected the
roles of social institutions.

B73DEADB6C2E4F8096BF5ED95AF62213.description:
Describe how the work of Catholic
missions change society.

BEA6BF8F4EB94DFDBABA2FB5A0DF09FF.description:
Describe how interaction among
people brings about social change (e.g.,
natives and colonizers, Peace Corps
volunteers).

2B4E9756AAC94F1A9B1ADBE697760F8B.description:
Understand the roles and interactions of individuals and groups in society. Understand the roles and interactions of individuals and groups in society and their role in the Church. Value the diversity among students in the classroom and school community as children of God. CSDS3
Analyze stories of important Catholic figures and saints who through their examples re-awaken that period’s moral sense. CSGS3 (7&8)
Discuss how religious and moral knowledge is a requisite for understanding the dram of human grandeur throughout history. CSGS4 (7&8
Value one’s own role and dignity in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5 (7&8)

82B5374562464B9BA684F5E014388B3A.description:
Evaluate the role of the humanities
(e.g., literature, art, music, architecture)
in culture.

188BF021488749FA817F4756DD16C9E0.description:
Draw conclusions about how the media
creates and/or reinforces societal
norms.

40ED21DC40B64B4CBBCC95A5A2AD7A72.description:
Explain the concept of religious
tolerance.

15F7F302708E4A8F8507AC5320878AE7.description:
Define the concept of the global
community.

DA41357AEF8C4FA29984602BDFB790AB.description:
Identify various cultures that have
combined to create a larger,
multicultural American society.

6A318AEFFEF3473C8F0AE66C9A9BBC67.description:
Analyze immigration patterns to see
how American cultures have bee
shaped.

6937CE4C8EAA4DC5B3C3814964EDD445.description:
Predict how technology/media will
impact culture during the student’s
lifetime.

768A67BDC4884B99B7177B771E18A0A7.description:
Compare characteristics of culture as reflected in language, literature, the arts, traditions, and institutions. Compare characteristics of religious culture as reflected in language, literature, the arts, traditions, and institutions. Select and describe beautiful artifacts from different times and cultures. CSDS1
Value the cultural inheritance the Church provides us yesterday and today. CSGS3
Value the unique qualities and characteristics of different cultures in order to pursue peace and understanding, knowledge and truth. CSDS6
(7&8)

805EC9A1594D41BE8CD68D6513B81B4C.description: Understand social systems, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand religious aspects of social systems with an emphasis on the United States
